[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Scalable Secure E-Store System (SES) defines authentication, account management, payment security, and system scalability requirements for online transactions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: SES enables user registration, authentication, encrypted transactions, performance optimization, and system scalability for high availability and security.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: SES integrates with authentication, payment, and system monitoring services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: SES provides a structured UI for account management, browsing, purchasing, and order tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: SES runs on cloud-based infrastructure optimized for high availability and multi-device access.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: SES uses React.js frontend, Node.js backend, and PostgreSQL for secure transactional storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: SES ensures encrypted data exchange via TLS 1.3 and HTTPS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: SES optimizes resource allocation for secure transactions and high user loads.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: SES manages authentication, payment processing, performance monitoring, and order fulfillment.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: SES supports multi-device access, load balancing, and system scaling.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: SES connects to authentication, payment, and security monitoring APIs.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: SES enables secure registration, authentication, payment processing, order fulfillment, and system monitoring.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: SES is designed for customers, administrators, and support agents managing transactions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: SES requires stable internet connectivity for authentication and transactions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: SES relies on encryption, cloud hosting, and real-time system monitoring.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with authentication, payment, and system monitoring services.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide secure access to account registration, transactions, and system performance monitoring.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to register accounts and log in securely (REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enforce SSL encryption for authentication and payment transactions (REQ-INTF-001, REQ-INTF-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall scale resources dynamically to maintain performance during peak transaction loads (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for account management, product browsing, and transactions.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process authentication with minimal delay.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall maintain almost always uptime to ensure transaction reliability.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store credentials, transactions, and order history.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce encryption for authentication and transactions.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with SSL encryption standards and PCI-DSS for payment security.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure security, high availability, real-time performance monitoring, and proactive threat detection.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Authentication, registration, and transaction security validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and security policies.
[SEC] 5. References: SSL encryption standards, UI/UX best practices, and transaction security guidelines.
